summary: Low risk: 3 minor deviations from company standards

flags.title: Incomplete Payment Terms Information
flags.description: The contract clause specifies a fixed fee and payment deadline without defining the invoicing schedule or payment methods, which are standard components in the company's payment terms.; The contract clause does not explicitly mention reimbursement of expenses or responsibility for taxes, which are covered in the company standard.; The contract clause uses a fixed fee ('QAR 45,000') which deviates from the flexibility of [monthly/quarterly/project milestone] invoicing in the company standard. While not inherently a risk, it lacks the detail provided by the standard for ongoing service agreements.
flags.recommendation: The contract clause should be expanded to include details on invoicing schedule (e.g., monthly, quarterly, per milestone), acceptable payment methods, expense reimbursement policy, and tax responsibilities to align with company standards and mitigate potential ambiguities or disputes. The fixed fee amount should be explicitly linked to the defined service period or milestones.

flags.title: Missing Indemnification Clause
flags.description: Standard indemnification clause not found (appeared in 2 company contracts)
flags.recommendation: Add comprehensive indemnification clause matching company standards

flags.title: Missing Dispute Resolution Clause
flags.description: Standard dispute_resolution clause not found (appeared in 3 company contracts)
flags.recommendation: Add comprehensive dispute_resolution clause matching company standards

recommendations: Add comprehensive dispute_resolution clause matching company standards

The fixed fee amount should be explicitly linked to the defined service period or milestones.
